reviews.review_msg: Great professor, organized notes

His lecture style is him doing problems on paper which at first looks like dread but it will help you a lot and he gives you a very, very good and generous outline of what's directly on the exams + final exam. He cares about your learning, very good professor to take MACM with!
Lectures are pretty good and he gives you a pretty good idea of what will be on the exam. TAs aren't great but overall a solid prof

Not sure why there is so much excessive praise for Kay. Although he is clear with expectations both in terms of the lecture delivery and what he wants from students, the exams and the marking that he uses to assess student understanding of the course material are far from fair and reasonable.

Kay is a good professor, but falls short in a few areas. His writing can be hard to read at times, which can slow the pace of the lecture when you're trying to make sense of what he's writing down. Lectures follow the textbooks too closely, which de-values the lectures since you could skip and study solo. Thankfully, his exams are pretty fair.

MACM 101 is a tough course for most people but Kay taught the material in a very digestible way. He's a generous grader and his exams are extremely reasonable - he even told us the exact questions that would be on the final. Do the work, don't fall behind, and you'll do just fine

Wiese clearly cares about the success of his students. He is extremely reasonable in his assignment and test expectations and he is very organized and thorough with his lectures. Trust me when I say if you have to take MACM 101, take it with him.

This guy has been by far my favorite prof in my first term here by a longshot. His lectures are well structured, his notes are detailed with good examples and he's overall just a good dude. Final is worth 50% but he tells you what kind of questions to expect and prep for. If you need MACM please try to take it with him, even if its a 3 hour lecs.
Clear and solid lectures, an ideal choice! Can heavily depend on tests but those have a fair difficulty and are fairly marked.
Really nice professor and wants to see students do well. I really enjoyed the course with him and would take it again!

Dr. Kay is one of the best prof at SFU. He is very organised and his lecture is always helping you to understand the logic not memorising. If you regularly attend the lecture and follow his advice, at least B- is there. I hope all the course could be taught by him.

Amazing professor, clear explanation and is reachable after class even when he is busy and very approachable, the only professor I enjoyed having at sfu.

For midterm and final he clearly outlined which parts of the course would come and explaining what to kind of questions to focus on making the study process very streamlined.

Amazing guy

I appreciate his kind demeanour as he is always looking to help students out to clear questions. However, he is functionally not a professor. He is extremely lazy and rips all of his course content out from the textbook line by line and its not very helpful to go to clas since hee cant explain better than the textbook. Avoid if you want to learn.
He's an amazing prof. He gives clear indication on what he expects from students and is very helpful too.

The course itself is pretty outdated (bioinfomatics in 2000s) and not very interesting, its basically cmpt 307 with a bio component. Kay spends too much time on details about genetic algorithm that you will never use again. Dont get your hopes up, but at least theres no surprises in exam and cheat sheet is allowed.
Not accessible or helpful outside of class, I felt that he cares more about his research.

Dr. Wiese is a professor that actually acknowledges the fact that we're in a pandemic and adapts. If you do the homework and pay attention in lecture, you should be fine for the quizzes/tests. Very fair assessments as well. Highly recommend this professor.

Kay is a wonderful professor that respects your time. He adapted well to the online environment and ran the class without many hitches. Concepts were explained clearly and examples were given on how the knowledge would be used in the real world, something I believe more professors should do in order to demonstrate the usefulness of the material.

Hes been incredibly fair considering our circumstances around COVID. Made MACM pretty enjoyable and understandable. He is also very descriptive with his tests by warning exactly what to study for. Five assignments and he made the sixth one optional. Two quizzes, one midterm and one final. Take this GOAT��

Good professor, MACM is an extremely difficult course but he made it clear and straightforward. Tests are very challenging but fair; if you put in a lot of hours you will be able to get the mark that you are looking for. Did quite well with the online format. Wiese is recommended, but be sure to study hard as MACM is not an easy course!

Wiese was an incredible professor for the online Fall 2020 MACM101 class. He made sure to go out of his way to answer students in class and online through Canvas, and ensured that all his materials could be accessed retroactively. His lectures were extremely detailed but he still indicated which parts were testable. He is hard-headed about rules!

Simply an awesome prof. Even though classes are online, he tries to pass the inconveniences and give the highest level of education that you can receive under these conditions. Understands students and tries to support them at any time. Prefers Nutella over peanut butter. Would definitely take again!
Content is hard, but Kay makes things as clear as possible. This isn't a easy course though, so be prepared. You can tell he really cares about his students understanding the concepts.
Nice teacher
Class is difficult but he makes it fun to learn!
Good teacher, hard class
legendary proffessor
11/10 good boi
He's amazing, don't you dare take him for granted
One of the best prof I've ever had, his lecture is interesting and easy to follow. Would definitely recommand.
Great prof who really cares about his students, their learning experience, and is passionate about the material. Easily one of the best profs at SFU.
This professor is very inspirational and caring, regardless of me not liking the overall online format for SFU he did his absolute best to provide us educational content and it worked very well
Best Prof I ever had at SFU! Teaches very well and cares about student's learning and success. Would take again. 10/10
Good professor, humurous, and understands students do not have the luxury to invest all their time into one Math course. Tells you what to expect on the exams. 10/10 would take again
Nice guy but course itself is horrible. Final is 50% linear programming, do prepare for that.

He's a pretty good prof compared to the others for MACM 101, but he spends like the first 7 weeks on the easiest 2 chapters of the course, then spends the second half on the remaining 3 chapters that are a lot harder and based on theories and proofs. If you think you're good because you aced the midterm, you aren't he will F you on the final.

Awesome prof choice for MACM 101. As a first year, he introduced the concepts very well (however, it was very theory-heavy). It was an enjoyable class and he was always happy to help students whenever possible. The midterm / quiz were very easy, the final went into depth with specific concepts. Overall super enjoyable.

While lecture can be boring, he's a passionate professor and would answer and engage with any students who have questions. If you do your assignments, and review all concepts carefully (keyword - all), you would do well. Grades are fair, and for our class we get 66% average for midterm, which is pretty good in my opinion.

- He teaches well. TA and him have office hours. - Midterm average fall 58% and spring 68%.  - You must get +50% on final to get credits. (In fall, %20 of the class failed). - Lots of theory and PROOFS! - Homeworks are not mandatory, but help. - Every 2 weeks, there is an assignment (5-6 total). - Textbook Questions have solutions behind the book.

Avoid taking CMPT307 taught by Dr. Wiese if you want to learn computing algorithms. His lecture is very boring. He spends 70% of lecture time repeating the content from the textbook word by word. What makes it worse is the textbook he picked is not good (very ambiguous when discussing in-depth algorithms). He is a nice and polite prof. though.
Kay is awesome! He's very passionate about teaching and obviously knows what he's talking about. The course itself is quite difficult but he offers alot of examples and extra help when asked.

Excluding content, very good at teaching and presenting. Sows down on difficult or important topics we need to grasp. Because MACM 101 is filled with facts, it restrains time that we don't get to comprehend the material clearly. But, friendly, and will give you tips for the exams. Exams are not hard. Recommended to study early. Cool accent, btw!

The first midterm is worth 40% and is basically a freebie as he makes it easy. The lectures are slow before the first midterm. Then he goes very fast after it, with a final   worth 50% and is way more difficult than the material you see in class.
Great professor and can teach this course incredibly well. Be prepared to attend every lecture and take notes. The notes are incredibly helpful and will help you succeed in his class.
Lecures were a bit confusing. Markings is fair.
Not the worst prof, but  defintely could have been better! Assignments are tough. I would have taken this with another prof if I could do this again.

He's a great prof, once he gets warmed up with the class he's more easy-going and it makes the lectures a little more fun. Attendance to lectures is mandatory if you want to pass because he handwrites his notes, therefore they cannot be downloaded off the internet. However, he is quite good at explaining and is there to help.

As long as you do all the review, readings, and assignments to the point that you fully understand all the concepts, you're guaranteed an A in this class. Attending lecture is crucial, he covers a lot of material in class, especially after the first midterm. Very willing to help, and most importantly, teaches extremely well!
Final exam has to be passed to pass the entire class... really terrible policy
Read the examples from the text book and focus on sets,functions  and relations are important. Midterm was very easy(82% avg) and final was fair.  The easiest prof in teaching MACM 101
People are way too nice. His midterms are not that easy and his final exams are way too hard. He teaches extra material that he didn't cover in class and tests you on it in the final exam.

Pretty good prof with decent teaching skills. The midterm exam was quite easy, but the final could honestly not have been more tricky. All in all, he seems to be one of the best profs teaching MACM101, which is not an easy course. I kinda recommend him, actually!
Easiest A+ I have get,best prof ever
78% midterm, 59% final average. 11/92 people failed the course because they failed the final. (thats his rule)... best to study assigments
One of the best professors for teaching MACM 101. Midterm was extremely easy. As long as you attend lecture and do the homework/review questions, you can easily get 80%+

I highly recommend Dr. Wiese.  Very clear, helpful and patient.  Obvious he really knows his stuff.  He makes the course easy for you; and only tests you on relevant material. (and the cheat sheet really takes the stress out of the exam)

Very Good Prof. If you do not understand anything he will explain very well. If you do understand it can be quiet boring. Assignments and Midterms are very similar and he allows cheat sheets on finals and midterms. Highly recommended you take him for MACM.

He was a great teacher. I did great for the midterm (A), then I slacked off after that. I only completed half of every assignment, which was a big mistake. JUST fully complete the assignments and study for the final (which was, whether  I had continued to study hard or not throughout the course, harder than the midterm)and you will get ur A or B.

MACM 101 by Kay is the easist A. All the class is talkin abt Junior higih and high school stuff. MIdterm is pretty is easy. Final is much trickier. four assigments are vital. But if u review bf exam, then an AAAAA.
